properties.name: Govindghat
properties.title: Govindghat
properties.description: At Govinda Lake, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya spent three days sharing stories about Shri Krishna's divine actions. Krishnadas Meghan prayed to the guru to have a divine vision of the realm within the Govardhan Hill, but Shri Mahaprabhujji did not respond to his request.

properties.name: Badi Bhitar Baithak
properties.title: Badi Bhitar Baithak
properties.description: Shri Mahaprabhuji's largest seat at Gokul was where he ate and gave discourses. Shri Krishna Chaitanya's disciples wanted to serve Shri Nathji, but he told them to worship Him by chanting His names for liberation. Only Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya had the right to His personal services.

properties.name: Mandarachal
properties.description: Location guessed by creators. On the summit of the Mudrachal mountain Shri Mahaprabhuji made his seat under a shady tree. After visiting Lord Mudrachal’s temple he began his saptah and Lord Mudrachal came to listen. Later, Shri Mahaprabhuji went to Lord Madhusudana’s temple and made the Lord’s worship. Shri Krishna then told Shri Mahaprabhuji that he had appeared on the Govardhan Hill and that he should quickly come to the sacred area of Braja and extablish His worship.

properties.name: Bansivat
properties.description: Gopaldas, a disciple of Shri Krishna Chaitanya, wished for a Deity he could adorn with clothes and jewels, but was only given a shaligram. After approaching Shri Mahaprabhuji in Vrindavan, he was told that the shaligram would transform into a svarupa of Shri Krishna if he worshipped it with pure sentiment. The next morning, Gopaldas' shaligram transformed into Radha Raman. Shri Mahaprabhuji also told Gopaldas that in his next birth, he would enter the path of Grace. Gopaldas later became known as Gopal Naga, a renowned devotee.”

properties.name: Vishramghat
properties.description: Shri Mahaprabhuji showed Prabhudas that the greatness of Vrindavan is concealed to some and visible to others. Gopaldas desired a Deity he could adorn and asked for Shri Krishna Chaitanya's help, who entrusted him with a shaligram. After having a dream, Gopaldas asked Shri Mahaprabhuji if he could have a svarupa of Lord Krishna. Shri Mahaprabhuji said that the shaligram would be transformed if his sentiment was pure. The shaligram became Radha Raman, and Gopaldas became a disciple of the path of Grace in his next birth, known as Gopal Naga.

properties.name: Madhuvan
properties.description: Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya visited the Lord Madhuvaniyan’s temple in Madhuvan, took a seven day discourse on Shrimad Bhagavatam and the Lord listened. He advised the temple priest to perform worship early so he could hear. Shri Mahaprabhu then continued his pilgrimage of Braja with five companions.

properties.name: Kumodvan
properties.description: Shri Mahaprabhuji visited Talvana lake but did not give a discourse since there was no Lord Krishna deity there. At Kamodvan, he explained that the place was named after the Kamodini trees and made two lotus ponds. He granted divine vision of the lotuses and trees to his disciples but had to take it away to prevent them from being too absorbed. He then went to Bahulavan, bathed in Sanatanu and Gandharva lakes, and rested under a tree by Krishna lake.

properties.name: Bahulavan
properties.description: At Bahulavan, Shri Mahaprabhuji gave discourses and showed the non-Hindu king the Image of the Vahula cow eating grass. The king became a disciple in his next life. Shri Mahaprabhuji then went to Jikhan and had the sight of Balaram and proceeded to Radha kund.

properties.name: Radhakrishna Kund
properties.description: Shri Mahaprabhuji stayed for a month under a tree beside Radha Kund lake, where he saw Shri Radha-Krishna and accompanied them to Govardhan mountain. His disciples lost consciousness and were revived by water from his pot. Shri Mahaprabhuji bathed in the eight lakes of the eight gopis and explained the greatness of Radha and Krishna's lakes. At Kusumasarovar lake, he recited one sloka of Bhramar Gita to Uddhava and discussed its purport for 36 hours. Then he went to Gwala Pokhar and Mansi Ganga at Govardhan and sat under a Chhokar tree.

properties.name: Mansiganga
properties.description: Shri Mahaprabhuji visited Mansi Ganga for seven days and gave discourses on Srimad Bhagavatam. Shri Krishna Chaitanya, who had taken a vow of silence until completing 125,000 names of the Lord, came to see Shri Mahaprabhuji after hearing about his arrival. Shri Mahaprabhuji sprinkled water from his pot onto the eyes of Shri Krishna Chaitanya and the Vaishnavas, giving them a divine vision of Mansi Ganga as a lake of milk. Later, Shri Mahaprabhuji read Srimad Bhagavatam daily and Chakleswr Mahadev came to listen.

properties.name: Parasoli
properties.description: At parasoli, Shri Mahaprabhuji, after having the sight of Bansivatm took his bath in the candra well at Candrasaroouvar. There He stayed for seven days, making the reading of the Srimad Bhagavatam. While residing there, Shri Mahapraabhuji showered His grace over all the Vaishnavas present there and showed them Lord Krisha’s divine Rasa dance

properties.name: Anyor
properties.description: At Anyor, Shri Mahaprabhuji had His divine meeting with Shri Nathji. There, Shri Mahaprabhuji established a small temple for Shri Nathji (Lord Krishna) and alos gave discourse on the Shrimad Bhagavatam.

properties.name: Govindkund
properties.description: At the Govinda lake, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya passed theree days speaking about Shri Krishna’s lilas. Krishnadas Meghan prayed to the guru to have the divine vision of the realm within the Govardhan Hill, but Shri Mahaprabhujji remained silent to his request.

properties.name: Sundershila
properties.description: At the Sundar Shila on th Govardhan hill Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhachayra performed the Dipawali and Anakuta festivals and used one and one fourth kilo of rice. His grandson Shri Gokulnathji, many years later had the divine vision of Shri Mahaprabhuji performing this celebration.

properties.name: Govardhan hill
properties.description: On top of the Giriraj Mountain, on the balcony of Shri Nathji’s temple, Shri Mahaprabhuji used to sit when His worship of Shri Nathji was concluded. Onc when the Lord’s offering was late he heard Shri Radha’s anklet bells. Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhcharya turned and saw Her coming with a tray in order to receive the preparations which would be offered to Her Lord. Shri Mahaprabhuji later said to Dammala, we should never be late in making the offering to the Lord, because it troubles the Divine Couple.

properties.name: Kamvan
properties.description: Here at Gusainji’s seat Mahaprabhuji gave darshan to Madhusudandas, after his ‘leelapravesh’. Madhusudandas did Mahaprabhuji’s seva daily & Chanted Shri Sarvottam Stotra, He had a wish to do Mahaprabhuji’s Darshan. Doing so, 1 month passed & Shri Gusainji came & stayed there for three days, & went away. After 6 months Mahaprabhuji gave Madhusudandas’ Darshan & told him “You needn’t have waited so long. When shri Gusainji came here, & gave you darshan you saw a difference in me & him & waited. Firstly, Vaishnav’s Duty is not to be Persistent, that’s why you took long to get my Darshan. If you wished to do my Darshan you could have gone to my lineage, wherever they reside

properties.name: Trilokbhan
properties.description: Location guessed by creators. Here, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya halted in a lovely spot. Many Mayavadians lived there who worshipped a goddess. When they heard about Shri Mahaprabhuji’s arrival, they came there to debate with him. Within a short while, Shri Mahaprabhuji revealed to them the true meaning of the scriptures and the path of Grace and they became his disciples. Later, Lord Trilokbhanji appeared to Shri Mahaprabhuji and the guru offered Him some fruits and made the Lord’s ornamentation. Shri Mahaprabhuji stayed there for a few days before proceeding to Totadri Mountain.

properties.name: Ghewarvan
properties.description: Here, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya stayed by a lake and held a ‘Bhagavata saptah’. One day he went on a walk to see the Gahavarvan forest and saw a dead boa constrictor with many ants biting it saying, “why did you ruin our lives|”  After bathing in piri and Prem lake Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya and his disciples proceeded towards Sanket.

properties.name: Sanketvan
properties.description: Madhusudandas served Mahaprabhuji daily and wished to have his darshan. After waiting for a month, Shri Gusainji visited and stayed for three days, and Madhusudandas saw a difference between him and Mahaprabhuji. He then waited for six more months until Mahaprabhuji gave him darshan and advised him that as a Vaishnav, he need not be persistent and could have sought darshan from Mahaprabhuji's lineage elsewhere.

properties.name: Nandgam
properties.description: A Muslim witnessed a miracle performed by Mahaprabhuji and asked to become his disciple but was told that his liberation would happen in his next birth. He was later reborn as Sangji and became proficient in spells and mantras. After failing to harm a Vaishnava with his spells, Sangji surrendered to Shri Vitthalnathji and took initiation, becoming an accomplished devotee.

properties.name: Kokilavan
properties.description: Gokulnathji knowing the promise of Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya made Chaturnaga his disciple. From that time, Chaturnaga always went about sing the glories of his guru. At the age of 150 he dropped his body at Govinda lake by the Govaradhan hill and enter into Krishna’s lila.

properties.name: Bhandirvan
properties.description: Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya traveled to various places, held a reading of the Shrimad Bhagavatam in Bhandirvan, and was visited by Byastirth, a religious head of the Madhava Sampradaya. Byastirth offered him 100,00 rupees and his religious position but was beaten by the Lord's servants for his prideful attitude. They advised him to seek the Lord's protection instead.

properties.name: Mansarovar (Makhan)
properties.description: Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya stopped by a tree near Pampa lake and asked Krishnadas to bring some leaves. While collecting leaves, Krishnadas encountered a frightening beast who requested him to ask the guru to liberate him. Later, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya and his disciples left the place.

properties.name: Sukar kshetra (Soramji/Sauroji)
properties.description: In the area of Soram Kshetra at Soram Ghat, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya made his halt. There Krishnadas Meghan went to see his former guru wiothout Mahaprabhuji’s permission. His previous guru asked him, “why have you made a second guru” Krishnadas replied, “ you are my guru and it is by your grace I have come into contact with Lord Vallabhacharya.”

properties.name: Chitrakut
properties.description: Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya gave a discourse on the Shrimad Bhagavatam and Ramayan under a tree by the Kantanath mountain. Hanuman stood on one foot to listen but refused to sit as it was his vow. Mahaprabhuji explained that the mountain should not be walked upon. The mountain later disguised itself as a Brahman and asked Mahaprabhuji for food, claiming that Sita and Ram were hungry on top of the mountain.

properties.name: Ayodhya
properties.description: Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya held a discourse on the Shrimad Bhagavatam and Ramayan under a tree near the Kantanath mountain. Hanuman, the monkey god, came to hear the discourse standing on one foot, but Mahaprabhuji asked him to sit. Later, Hanuman doubted Shri Rama's statement about being governed by law, but Shri Mahaprabhuji proved his words true. Hanuman saw Lord Ram in Shri Mahaprabhuji when he presented him with food, and Lord Ram affirmed Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya's superiority.

properties.name: Naimisharanya
properties.description: Here by the Gomati lake, under a tree, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya spoke the Bhagavatam for seven days. Once while he was making his to their sacrifice. After beginning the sacred rite, they all sat down and offered worship to him and requested to know the true import of sacrifice. For nine hours Shri Mahabrabhuji unlightened then before returing to his lamp many other events happened here, but this was the main once.

properties.name: Kashi 1
properties.description: Here, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya stayed at the house of Purushttamdas and celebrated Lord Krishna’s appearance day. During the festivities, Krishna’s parents and friends all appeared. Everyond present had this divine vision and Shiva joined in the celebrations.

properties.name: Kashi 2
properties.description: At the Hanuman Ghat by the Ganges river, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhachrya stayed after he took sanyas, the highest order of renunciation. He live for one month on a stone completely silent without eating or drinking anything. There, Shri Mahaprabhuji wrote a work about true renunciation which cleared the doubts of many misled people who had taken an outer renunciation neglecting the true inner one. On the day of Rath Yatra, Shri Mahaprabhuji entered into the Ganges river up to his waist and while singing the glorious Gopi Gita, ascended to the divine abode in a stream of light before thousands of people. Everyone who considered him to be only a ordinary man, after seeing his divine departure realized his divinity.

properties.name: Harihar Kshetra (Sonpur) Baithakji Hajipur
properties.description: Where the Ganges river and Gallika rivers meet, resides Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya’s disciple Bhagavandas. Here, the guru eternally resides. After Shri Mahaprabhuji’s physical dissappearance for the world, all of his followers were deeply grieved. Some bhaktas went to the house of Bhagavandas to tell him the news. Bhagavandas immediately consoled them, “Our blessed teacher is still here.” When he opened the doors to his private temple, all the Vaishnavas had the sight of Shri Mahaprabhuji sitting there reading the Shrimad Bhgavatam.

properties.name: Janakpur
properties.description: Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya stayed in a garden above the Mansi tank, where Kevalram Naga of the Vishnu Svami Sampradaya visited him. Kevalram was initiated into the path of Grace and then initiated 500 hermits. Shri Mahaprabhuji advised Kevalram to undertake his own pilgrimage and granted his request for a feast for all the hermits. On Lord Ram's appearance day, there were abundant milk sweets that did not diminish even after being served to all the hermits. This greatly astonished Kevalram, and Bhagavands became Shri Mahaprabhuji’s disciple here.

properties.name: Gangasagar Sangam
properties.description: In the dense forest of Kapilban at Kapilashram, Shri Mahaprabhuji spent six months finishing the third canto of his Subodhani. At that isolate place, inhabited by ferocious animals, Mahaprabhuji was accompanied by only five disciples.

properties.name: Champaranya
properties.description: For the Lord’s graceful glance came the divine souls and from his glance of maya came te demonical souls. Shri Mahaprabhuji appeard to uplift divine souls. That is the reason for his appearance. Shri Vitthalnathji said that if Shri Mahaprabhuji did not appear, “The creation of the divine souls would pass wasted.” He also revealed that, “Fro th eupliftment of divine souls, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya appeard upon the earth.”  In the south of India, in the town of Kankarvad appeared Shri Vallabhacharya’s forefather Narayanbhatt who was an incarnation of the Vedas and knew th esacred texts by heart. He started to perform the sacred soma. Sacrifice and complete 32 such rites in the course of his lifetime. When they were completed a celestial voice came from the sacrificial pit fire and said, “Narayana Bhatt, you are blessed; the primal Godhead has accepted your offerings. Within your family the Lord will take birth and from the sacrificial fires my Deity will appear.”

properties.name: Champaranya Chattighar
properties.description: Madhaananda and Mukundads both received boons to see Krishna's divine realm and Braja lila, respectively. They were advised to go to the Champaranaya forest where Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya was born. Upon seeing the divine child, they both received the sacred sight of the divine abode and left their material bodies to enter into the eternal lila.

properties.name: Jagannathpuri
properties.description: Shri Vallabhacharya traveled to several holy sites, including Gaya and Ganga Sagar, where he worked on his commentary on the third canto of the Shrimad Bhagavatam, called Shri Subodhini. Later, in Jagannath Puri, he stood all night in the temple, singing the praises of rice prasada on a fast day. When the king asked him about the highest Deity, main scripture, most holy mantra, and most exalted work, he wrote down the questions and awaited the Lord's response. Lord Jagannath answered that the Gita is the main scripture, Lord Krishna is the highest God, His name is the highest mantra, and His service is the most exalted work.

properties.name: Pandharpur
properties.description: A lad gave a mat to Lord Vitthalnathji and was granted three wishes. The Lord promised to always remain in his home, speak His names, and grant him the sight of Braja land. Years later, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya arrived and visited the temple, offering seven golden coins. Later, he took the lad and seven Vaishnavas into a deep forest where they had the sight of Krishn’s eternal Braja land. Shri Mahaprabhuji explained that the lad was blessed with this vision because he served Lord Vitthalnathji.

properties.name: Nasik
properties.description: At panchvati at the Nasika Tap forest Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhachrya said to Damala, “Lord Rama stayed in this forest and this is where Sita was stolen away by Ravana. I will make a Bhagavata saptah here and establish the path of Dvotion.”

properties.name: Pannakala Nrisimha
properties.description: Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya met Lord Nirsingh while sitting under a tree, and the Lord asked him to bless his temple. Mahaprabhuji offered bananas in sugar and rose water to Lord Nirsingh, who appreciated the offering. They then went to the temple, and after Mahaprabhuji offered the bananas, Lord Nirsingh gave half to Mahaprabhuji, which he refused, and the Lord gave the remaining to him. Mahaprabhuji then spoke the Shrimad Bhagavatam, and Lord Nirsingh came daily to listen, and many souls were uplifted by the guru's teachings.

properties.name: Tirupati Lakshman Balaji
properties.description: After performing his father’s last rites, he told his mother to proceed with his brother to his uncle’s house at Vidhyanagar while he stayed for 15 days under a tree near the temple. There he gave a seven day discourse on the Shrimad Bhagavatam and Lord Lakshman Balaji came to participate. After the discourse was completed Shri Mahaprabhuji went to the temple and made the Lord a food offering and perform His divine worship. The Lord appeared to Shri Vallabhacharya three other times, but these meeting have not been recorded.

properties.name: Shrirangji
properties.description: At Shri Rangji under a tree by the banks of the Kaveri river Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya stayed. There, Lord Rangji came from His eternal abode to see Shri Mahaprabhuji. And asked the guru about the divine appearance of Shri Nathji atop the Govardhan hill. Shri Mahaprabhuji later went to Lord Rangji’s temple where the head priest upon seeing Shri Mahaprabhuji had a vision and later took initiation form the guru.  During Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya’s seven day reading of the Shrimad Bhagavatam, many followers of the Mayavada arrived there and impressed with his teaching became his followers.

properties.name: Vishnukanchi
properties.description: At Vishnu Kanchi, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya stayed by the banks of the Surbhi river. Here, Shri Mahaprabhuji mentioned, “In India, there are 7 puris, {spiritual centers} three and one half are Vishnu’s and the three and one half are Shiva’s Vishnu’s puris are Mathura, Ayodhya, Dwarka and Vishnu Kanch is the last half.”  Lord Varadraj Knowing Mahaprabhuji’s feelign had all the 26 stone steps removed and only then did the guru visit the temple. For two hours, Shir Mahaprabhu had intimate discussion with the Lord. Later he offered seven golden coins to the temple and special offerings wer prepared. The head priest there, realizing Shir Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya’s divinity fell into a trance and when the guru awoke him the priest said, “I was having the divine sight of the Govardhan Hilll and the yamuna river, why did you awake me?”

properties.name: Setubandh
properties.description: Here Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya explained to Krishnadas Meghan that Shri Ram crossed by bridge over the sea to Shri Lanka t rescue Shri Sita from the demon Ravana. Here Lord Rameshvaram come to visit Shri Mahaprabhuji Here by the dust of Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya’s lotus feet, many souls abecame qualified to make the Llord’s worship.

properties.name: Malayachal Parvat
properties.description: Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya visited a sandalwood forest and Lord Henmagapal appeared to him, praising him for establishing the path of Grace. Shri Mahaprabhuji visited the Lord's temple and offered offerings. Lord Henmagapal regularly visited Shri Mahaprabhuji, and on the last day of his discourse, Indra learned of Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya's divinity and praised him.

properties.name: Lohgadh
properties.description: Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya stayed here under a tree by a large rock which had the impressions of an elephant’s footprint. Damala requested the guru, “This scenic place is full of souls who are ignorant by nature. If you speak the Bhagavata here, all these souls will be uplifted. Krishnadas Meghan then Said, “The only problem here is that there is no water.”

properties.name: Tamraparni River
properties.description: By the banks of the Tamraparni river, under a tree three miles form a large city, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya stayed. The king of the nearby state was very ill and someone told him, “If you construct a gold statue of yourself and gift it to a Brahmin, the Brahmin will die and you will be cured.”  The distressed king then retired to the banks of the Tamraparni awaiting his death. There he saw Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya and said to him. “This land is doomed because the holy class is devoid of spirituality.”

properties.name: Krishna River
properties.description: Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya stayed near a city by the Tamraparni river where a king, who was ill, was told that if he constructed a gold statue of himself and gifted it to a Brahmin, he would be cured. However, no Brahmin accepted the statue as it was death personified. Shri Mahaprabhuji arrived and accepted the gift, but melted down the statue and gave small amounts of gold to many Brahmins. He explained that one should never make such a large gift for the removal of one's own pain, and that by giving small gifts to many Brahmins, no harm will come to anyone. The king and many others became Shri Mahaprabhuji's disciple.

properties.name: Pampa Sarovar
properties.description: Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya halted by the Pampa lake and encountered a terrifying beast who asked for his liberation through the guru's grace. Shri Mahaprabhuji gave Krishnadas sacred water to sprinkle on the beast, which transformed it into a divine form and ascended to Vaikuntha. The guru then spoke the Shrimad Bhagavata and proceeded with his disciples.

properties.name: Padmanabh
properties.description: At a lovely spot, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya made his camp. Here Shri Mahaprabhuji told Damala, “From the navel of Shri Pdmanabhaji who lies resting on the serpent god, Braham the creator emerged on the stem of a lotus, “After saying that, Lord Padmanabhaji arrived and the guru greeted Him with folded hands

properties.name: Janardan Kshetra
properties.description: Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya and his disciples visited a temple of Lord Janardan by a lake, and after adorning the deity, Lord Janardan praised Shri Mahaprabhuji's sacred touch. Shri Mahaprabhuji then spoke the Bhagavata for seven days, during which many souls became initiated into the devotional path.

properties.name: Vidyanagar
properties.description: Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya defeated the Mayavadians in a religious conference at Vidhyanagar, where the king had invited scholars from the four Vaishnava lineages to debate with the Mayavadians. He was able to defeat them with his teaching of Brahmavada, which states that everything is God and nothing but God. The king offered Mahaprabhuji 600 Ibs of gold and honored him with a sacred bath. Shri Mahaprabhuji distributed the gold to all the Brahmins and accepted the leadership of the Vishnu Svami lineage at the request of its head. He stayed in Vidhya Nagar for a few days giving discourse at the royal palace before proceeding onwards. Along the way, he initiated Damodardas as his disciple.

properties.name: Totadri
properties.description: Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya and his disciples made camp in a jungle where there was no water. The guru told them about a hidden lake under a rock, which was later discovered and named Vallabh lake. Mayavadians came to investigate and were amazed by the discovery. They prayed to become disciples and everyone experienced divine joy. Shri Mahaprabhuji then continued his journey with some disciples, while others returned home.

properties.name: Darvasen
properties.description: Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya camped in a dangerous jungle, where Lord Varadasen warned him of the danger and prophesied that his descendants would bless divine souls in the future. The guru then conducted a seven-day reading of the Bhagavata and enlightened numerous people before moving on.

properties.name: Bharuch
properties.description: Here, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya stayed by the banks of the holy Narmada river. There, a young women adorned from head to toe with celestial jewels came and bowed at Mahaprabhuji’s feet and said, “I know the reason ;for your appearance is solely for the upliftment of divine souls. You wander about sanctifying holy places and rivers by your mere logch please bless this Narmada river by bathing in her waters.”

properties.name: Morbi
properties.description: Here Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya halted by the edge of the Krishna lake where he mentioned to Krishnadas, “This town was previously ruled by the great devotee king Satyavadi. The banks of this lake were blessed by Shri Krishna and Arjuna. The guru then decided to hold a discourse of the Bhagavata.

properties.name: Jamnagar
properties.description: Shri Mahabprabhuji's Baithakji at Navanagar near Naagmati river.

properties.name: Jamkhambhaliya
properties.description: By the banks of a laovely pond, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya spoke the Bhagavatam. One afternoon a Brahmin arrived there and said, “you should not spend the night here because a man-eating ghost wanders about at night.” Despite his warning, the guru did not move the camp.

properties.name: Pindtarak
properties.description: Here, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya stayed under a large tree where he mentioned to his disciple Damala “when Krishna was king of Dwarka, he visited all these nearby holy places. This is where the sage’s Dhurvasa’s hermitage was.” Later, the religious guide of the area approached Shri Mahaprabhu and seeing his spiritual splendor requested initiation. Shri Mahaprabhuji advised. “This holy area will liberated you.” After giving him a generous gift, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya headed onwards.

properties.name: Mul Gomti
properties.description: Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya shared with Krishnadas Meghan the story of how the Mulgomati river came to be, which involved a princess taking on the form of the river to merge with Lord Dwarkanathji. Later, a renunciate visited Shri Mahaprabhuji and shared his struggles on the path of renunciation. Shri Mahaprabhuji advised the renunciate and initiated him, telling him that he would leave his body and take birth near the Govardhan Hill. Shri Mahaprabhuji then traveled to Shri Dwarka.

properties.name: Harikund, Dwarka
properties.description: At Dwarka, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya stayed by the bands of the Gomati river. There, Lord Dwarkanathji came to met Shri Mahaprabhu and requested him to pass the four months of the rainy season there. Lord Dwarkanathji told the head priest of His temple Govindadas about Shri Mahaprabhuji’s divinity and that he could achieve true devotion through his grace. Govindadas then brought Shri Mahaprabhuji to the temple where the guru made the Lord’s divine services.

properties.name: Gopi Talav
properties.description: At Gopi Talaiya, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya explained to Krishnadas Meghan the story of why the Gopis of Braja were at Gopi Talaiya, near Dwarka, instead of in Braja. When Lord Krishna praised the Gopis of Braja in front of his Dwarka Queen Rukmuni, she claimed she would do the same as them, but ultimately did not. Meanwhile, the Gopis of Braja came to Lord Krishna when he played His flute at Gopi Talaiya. Shri Mahaprabhuji gave divine eyes to the bhaktas present to witness the Lord's lila with the Gopis, then left for Shankoddhar after speaking the Bhagavata for seven days.

properties.name: Bet Shankhoddhar
properties.description: Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya stopped by Shanka Lake and mentioned to Damala about Lord Shanknarayan and how Lord Dwarkanathji sports here. He made worship at Lord Shankanaryana's temple and the Lord asked him to speak on the Gopi's 'Song to a Flute' for three days and nights, explaining a single verse. The area was filled with bliss and he proceeded to Narayana Sarovar after completing his discourse.

properties.name: Narayan Sarovar
properties.description: Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya visited the hermitage of sage Markandeya near the Narayana lake, where Lord Shiva came to listen to his Bhagavata discourse. Shri Mahaprabhuji mentioned that the area was blessed by the Lord's presence and spoke about his descendants who would go to Sind to initiate divine souls into the path. Although he did not go in that direction, the aroma of his lotus feet liberated souls as far away as Kabul.

properties.name: Junagadh
properties.description: At Junagard by the banks of the Revati lake under a tree, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya halted. After making came the Girnar and Revatachal mountains took on the forms of two young Brahmins boys and went to see Shri Mahaprabhuji and prayed, “you wander about purifying all of the holy places. Please bless these two mountains here by you touch.”  Shri Mahaprabhuji than sat on one the mountain’s stones which became as soft as butter. Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya’s footprint became embedded on the rock.

properties.name: Prabhas (Somnath)
properties.description: Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya stopped at a cave under a tree where Lord Balaram had been and began speaking on the Bhagavata. Lord Shiva used to listen to the discourses and later told his disciple to become Shri Mahaprabhuji's disciple. After initiating him, Shri Mahaprabhuji visited all the sacred areas there before moving on.

properties.name: Madhavpur
properties.description: Here, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya stopped by the side of the Kadam lake and mentioned to Damala, “It was here Lord Krishna and Rukmuni were married and in this lake they bathed. Afterwards, all the saints and hermits present at the ceremony also bathed.”

properties.name: Gupta Prayag (Junagadh)
properties.description: Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya halted at Junagard by the banks of the Revati lake, where two mountains took on the forms of two young Brahmins and asked for his blessings. Shri Mahaprabhu bathed in the Damodar lake and found a Deity, which he gave to a bhakta for personal worship. A yogi requested him to speak the Shrimad Bhagavatam, and for seven days the yogi came and attentively listened. Shri Mahaprabhuji later revealed that the yogi was Ashavastham, the son of Dronacharya.

properties.name: Tagadi
properties.description: Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya sat under a tree near a Brahmin's house. The Brahmin's wife caught her sons eating freshly churned butter and told her husband. The guru told them to embrace their sons and see their play as Lord Krishna's lila. The Brahmin then explained to his wife how a saint had blessed their house and they could become true devotees. The wife's attitude changed and she hugged her sons, elated that they had eaten the butter.

properties.name: Naroda
properties.description: At Naroda, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya stayed at the home of Gopaldas. The guru gave Gopaldas knowledge of Shri Krishna and initiated him into hte path of Grace and gave him a Krishna Deity to serve. His wishes fulfilled, he remained in transcendental bliss always singing the glories of his guru and Shri Krishna. After speaking on the Shrimad Bhagavata Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhachayra proceeded to Godhra.

properties.name: Godhra
properties.description: At godhra, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya stayed at the home of Ranavyasa. Before he took initiation, he was a great scholar of vedic literature and was very proud of his extensive learning. Once, when he was defeated in Benares, he became so depressed that he decided to drown himself in the Ganges river. At that time, Shri Mahaprabhuji was performing his prayers on the nearby banks and Krishnadas Meghan asked the guru what was the fruit received from drowning oneself in the Ganges river. Shri Mahaprabhuj explained, “That soul would undergo at least seven hellish lives and would gain no fruits here or elsewhere.”

properties.name: Kheralu
properties.description: Here, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya stayed at the home of Jagannath Josi upon who the guru was very pleased. After Shri Mahaprabhuji prepared the meals and made the offering he partook of the prasada before Jagannath requested him the explain to him the Gopi’s “Yugal Gita” song which appears in the 10 canto of the Shrimad Bhagavatam. For nine hours Shri Mahaprabhuji spoke and immersed all present there in complete transcendental bliss. Form there, he proceeded to siddhapur.

properties.name: Siddhpur
properties.description: At Siddhapur, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya halted by the side of the Bindu lake and related to Damala, :Here the great sage kardama had his hermitage and also here is the spot where Lord Kapildeva taught his mother Devatuti the Sandhya Yoga system. Devahuti then took on the form of this Bindu lake.”

properties.name: Avantikapuri (Ujjain)
properties.description: Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya came to Avantika Puri and found no place to hold a discourse until a devotee suggested that he could make a forest. The next day, a huge pipal tree grew where he sprinkled water, providing a shady place to hold the discourse. Lord Shiva's two great devotees attended the discourse, and Lord Shiva later went to hear it himself. Shiva then called all the Mayavadians for a religious debate, and Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya proved Brahmavada to be the essence of Vedic thought. The Mayavadians received initiation from Shri Mahaprabhuji, and Lord Shiva praised him for his divinity.

properties.name: Pushkar
properties.description: Pushkar has over 500 temples, with the Brahma temple being the most important. The town is also home to the famous Pushkar Lake, where Shri Mahaprabhuji’s Baithakji is situated. Shri Mahaprabhuji believed that Pushkar is the father of all holy places. Shri Brahmaji requested Shri Mahaprabhuji to salvage Pushkar, and after being pleased with his reply, Shri Mahaprabhuji read the Shrimad Bhagwat Parayan there, providing a spiritual experience for many people in the town.

properties.name: Kurukshetra
properties.description: By the Kurushetra lake, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya made his seat and told Krishnadas Meghan that, “It was here that the great Mahabharat war took place and it is also the place where Lord Krishna taught Arjuna the Bhagavat Gita.”

properties.name: Badrikashram
properties.description: On Lord Vaman’s appearance day, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya arrived at Badrinath high in the Himilayas. He told Krishna Meghan to find some fruits as grains are not taken on that day. Lord Badrinath, taking on the form of a brahmin stoped Krishnadas and told him, “It is good to please the guru, but you will not find any fruits here.”

properties.name: Kedarnath
properties.description: By the kedarnath lake in the Himilayas Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya made his seat and began the “saptah.” Lord Kedarnath disguised as a yogi would daily come to listen and finally Krishnadas Meghan questioned the guru who he was. Shri Mahaprabhuji smiled and revealed his identity. After the discourese was over, a divine aroma emerged from Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya’s feet and thousands of beings who merely smelled it became liberated. From here Shri Mahaprabhuji proceeded to Vyasashram.

properties.name: Vyas Ashram
properties.description: Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya visited Veda Vyasa in his cave and explained the Bhramar Gita for three days and nights, receiving praise from Veda Vyasa. Upon returning and finding Krishnadas Meghan standing where he left him, Shri Mahaprabhu granted him a boon, removing his sins of the tongue and establishing the teachings of the path of Grace firmly in his heart. However, he did not grant his request to accept his former guru. Shri Mahaprabhu then brought his disciples back into consciousness and left for Himachal after performing a saptah.

properties.name: Himachal Parvat
properties.description: On top of the Himachal mountain, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya made his seat. There, Krishnadas Meghan requested the guru to make a saptah. The Himachal mountain dressed as a Brahmin appeared there and Shri Mahaprabhuji took him that he would remain blissful by listening to the Shrimad Dhagavalam. By the completion of the sacred work many souls were enlightened.

properties.name: Vyas Ganga
properties.description: On the banks of the Vyasa Ganga, under a tree Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhachayra made his seat. Shri Mahaprabhuji explained to Damala that is was the place were Lord Vedavyasa was born. After bathing in the Vyasa Ganga the ‘saptah’ began and a divinely ornamented woman arrived and fanned Shri Mahaprabhuji for the whole discourse. Later it was revealed that she was the divine goddess form of the Ganges riverl

properties.name: Arail (Prayag)/Adel
properties.description: Shri Mahaprabhuji stayed in Adel where his eldest son, Shri Gopinathji was born in 1510. Shri Gopinathji had a love for Shrimad Bhagwat and Shri Mahaprabhuji wrote the book “Shri Purushottam Sahastra” for him. Shri Mahaprabhuji resided in Adel for many years and many historical events of significance in Pustimarg occurred during this time, including the Brahma Sambandh of Ashtachapp poet Shri Paramananddasji and the visit of Krishnadevaraya of Vijaynagar seeking Shri Mahaprabhuji’s darshan.

properties.name: Charnat
properties.description: At Charanat, Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya held a saptah in a bower. A Brahmin hermit who had daily recited the Vishunsahastranam found a Krishna Deity and brought Him to his hermitage, but the Lord instructed the Brahmin to take Him to Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya. Garga Acharya blessed Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya's son, Shri Vitthalnath Gusianji, predicting his great accomplishments. Shri Mahaprabhu Vallabhacharya knew his son was the Lord Himself, and a bhakta sang in joy.
